Class Slot

java.lang.Object
  Slot

public class Slot
extends java.lang.Object

This class is used to represent a single slot on the Sudoku board. It holds a list of possibilities, initially at 1-9, and as the solution to the board is computed these possibilities will disappear.

Version:
0.1
Author:
Sam Drucker, Dani Dickstein

Constructor Detail

Slot

public Slot()
Constructor for a Slot in the Sudoku board. Generates a new ArrayList of possibilities with Integers from 1-9.

Slot

public Slot(int i)
Constructor for a Slot in the Sudoku board. The slot is initialized to the given value.

Parameters:
i - The computed answer for this Slot (no other possibilities will exist)
Method Detail

first

public int first()
Regardless of whether this slot has a specific answer or not, this method will return the first possibility of what this slot might contain.

Returns:
The first of this slot's possible values

getAnswer

public int getAnswer()
If the slot has a specific answer, this method returns the answer. Otherwise, this method returns -1.

Returns:
The computed answer for this slot

getPossibilities

public int[] getPossibilities()
Returns an integer array representing the number of possibilities remaining for this Slot.

Returns:
The remaining possibilities.

isSingle

public boolean isSingle()
Determines whether the slot has only one possibility remaining.

Returns:
Whether the slot has a specific answer

numPossibilities

public int numPossibilities()
Find the number of possibilities remaining for this slot.

Returns:
Number of remaining possibilities.

remove

public void remove(int i)
Removes a given integer from the list of remaining possibilities.

Parameters:
i - The integer to remove

set

public void set(int i)
Sets a specific integer as the answer for this slot, removing all possibilities from the list other than itself.

Parameters:
i - The integer to set as the answer

value

public int value()
Same as getAnswer()
